definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: The gastrocnemius and soleus press the sole of the foot into the floor.
sentences.chinese: 腓腸肌和比目魚肌將腳底壓向地板。

sentences.english: As in Tadasana, lengthen and broaden the soles of both feet.
sentences.chinese: 就像在山式，延長和擴展你雙腳的腳底。

sentences.english: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat on floor.
sentences.chinese: 仰臥，膝關節彎曲，腳底平貼地面。

sentences.english: Begin by drawing your attention to the soles of your feet.
sentences.chinese: 從將注意力轉移到你的腳底開始。

sentences.english: After the walkathon, his soles were sore.
sentences.chinese: 長途步行後，他的腳底都痛了。

sentences.english: This vintage version comes with distressed fabric and yellowing to the sole and laces.
sentences.chinese: 這個葡萄酒版本來與困厄的織品和染黃到腳底和鞋帶。

sentences.english: Dr. Scholl's Air-Pille Insoles help take the place of that fatty tissue.
sentences.chinese: 司各爾博士氣式鞋墊可以替代腳底的脂肪層。

sentences.english: Service dogs and other working dogs are at particular risk for burn injuries.
sentences.chinese: 服務犬和其他工作犬會處於燒傷腳底板的危險。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were raw with chilblain.
sentences.chinese: 他的腳底生了凍瘡很疼痛。

sentences.english: The lines of the eight-spoked on the soles and palms of a Buddha are among them.
sentences.chinese: 佛陀腳底和手掌的八條輻輪線也是它們其中之一。

sentences.english: Besides, the harvest mouse has a remarkable ability to sense vibrations through the soles of its feet.
sentences.chinese: 此外，巢鼠還有很強的通過腳底感知震動的能力。

sentences.english: You will be sawed in half from head to toe.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你有兩邊的關係，所以用鋸子從頭頂鋸到腳底。

sentences.english: The soft skin of an elephant's foot acts much like a drum head, sensing vibrations.
sentences.chinese: 大象腳底柔軟的皮膚很像鼓面，能夠感知震動。

sentences.english: Lie on your back with the soles of your feet together and your knees bent and dropping toward the floor.
sentences.chinese: 首先平躺，兩腳底合十，兩膝微曲放在地板上。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were beaten.
sentences.chinese: 他的腳底板被毆打，還得了哮喘。

sentences.english: In such case, all hullabaloo will be under feet.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，才能將所有的喧囂，踩在腳底。

definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
hand and foot/movement of limbs/action/trick/step in a procedure (CL: 道[dao4])
knee/(Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
